summary:
I am a passionate Machine Learning Engineer specializing in Computer Vision and Robotics, with a strong foundation in deep learning, image processing, and embedded systems. With hands-on experience at leading AI startups and technology companies, I have successfully designed, developed, and deployed advanced computer vision solutions for real-world applications, including autonomous robotics, automotive damage detection, retail analytics, and healthcare.
My expertise spans the full machine learning pipeline—from research and prototyping to production deployment—leveraging Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, OpenCV, and cloud technologies such as AWS and Docker. I have a proven track record of improving model accuracy, optimizing inference speed, and reducing operational costs through innovative engineering and MLOps best practices.
As a collaborative team player and mentor, I have led machine learning teams, contributed to impactful R&D projects, and delivered scalable AI products for both local and international clients. I am currently pursuing a Master’s in Artificial Intelligence at IU International University of Applied Sciences, further strengthening my academic and practical expertise.
Driven by curiosity and a commitment to innovation, I am eager to contribute my skills to cutting-edge projects that solve complex challenges and create meaningful impact in the field of AI and computer vision.

projects.name: Autonomous Robot with Stereo Vision
projects.description: Development of an autonomous robot capable of navigating surfaces and avoiding obstacles using stereo vision. The project leverages ROS and Gazebo for simulation, and integrates a segmentation variant of the YOLO model for real-time object detection. The focus is on both software (simulation, perception) and hardware development.
details: Developed a robot simulation using ROS and Gazebo
Created a new ROS messages module for YOLO detection outputs
Built ROS Nodes to process frames from dual cameras and detect objects using a segmentation-based YOLO model
Currently working on developing the hardware components of the robot

links.name: ROS2 YOLO message service with stereo vision

projects.name: CarEye Capture
projects.description: An R&D project focused on computer vision tasks for vehicle inspection, including object detection, segmentation, and image processing. The system is designed to automatically detect and assess exterior vehicle damages, providing automated external evaluation and decision support for the automotive industry.
details: Trained object detection models to identify exterior vehicle damages, achieving 80% F1-score
Conducted research on damage segmentation and damage size estimation, reaching 75% accuracy on size estimation

projects.name: Planogram Compliance and Realogram Management System - Arigo AI
projects.description: An AI-powered system for automating planogram compliance and realogram management in retail environments. The solution uses computer vision to analyze shelf layouts, ensuring products are placed according to planograms, and provides real-time compliance reporting to retailers.
details: Implemented a custom algorithm using image warping and perspective correction to calculate product positions on shelves with 90% accuracy
Deployed the solution as a RESTful API on AWS cloud using containerization
Utilized AWS Sagemaker for efficient and scalable machine learning model deployment
Scaled the system to identify 200 distinct product classes

projects.name: Virtual Health Assistant (POC)
projects.description: A proof-of-concept telemedicine platform featuring a virtual health assistant for remote patient monitoring and vital tracking. The system uses computer vision to collect patient data and provides dashboards for healthcare professionals, aiming to enhance hospital workflow and patient care.
details: Deployed the solution to a local hospital with 80% accuracy
Enabled remote patient monitoring and vital tracking using computer vision
Developed dashboards for doctors and nurses to monitor patient status

projects.name: Automatic Vehicle Tracking System
projects.description: A prototype system for tracking vehicles entering and exiting facilities, leveraging deep learning and computer vision. The solution detects vehicles and license plates, tracks their movement, and uses OCR for license plate recognition, aiming to automate parking management and security.
details: Utilized Yolov4 for vehicle and license plate detection
Implemented centroid tracking algorithm to track vehicles with 95% accuracy
Integrated an improved OCR algorithm for license plate recognition with 95% accuracy
